item.description: Join us on a field trip to visit this unique part of New England culture on Saturday, August 27th. Located in Salem, NH, no one knows for sure exactly what this place is, who built it or why. Their website (www.stonehengeusa.com) says: “Built by a Native American Culture or a migrant European population? No one knows for sure. A maze of man-made chambers, walls and ceremonial meeting places, America's Stonehenge is most likely the oldest man-made construction in the United States (over 4000 years old).” Come with us and explore the roughly ½ mile of trails and rock formations and tunnels. This is an open event so bring friends, family, children. The site has some adorable alpacas, a concession stand and gift shop. Admission rates are: Adults: $10.00, Seniors(65+): $9.00, Children Ages 6-12: $7.00, Children 5 and Under: Free. Please let me know if you would like to carpool there – the ride is about 1 hour – or if you need directions to get there on your own. We will be leaving from KRI promptly at 10am. I highly recommend bringing dowsing rods and/or a pendulum, and a camera. SPRG and its affiliate groups are not responsible for any injuries or any lost or stolen property during any event.
item.name: Field Trip to Americaâ€™s Stonehenge!
